Any part.

name: deusoma
text:
Bright blue whale penis.
Rigid and proud.

name: soticoto
text:
Misleading statement.
The penis of a blue whale isn't itself blue.
It is a similar shade of pink to a cat's anus, but less hairy.
It is also longer than a horse (a whole horse) and can shoot many gallons of ejaculate.

name: sdskyle
text:
You can lame me all you want, but I kind of liked that movie. Sure, huge letdown, but I still enjoyed it.

Also, according to wikipedia:
"Carvey may hold the distinction of being the only comedian ever to be imitated by a former President of the United States at the funeral of another former President of the United States. At the January 2, 2007 funeral of Gerald Ford, George H. W. Bush reminisced in his eulogy about how Ford took it in stride when SNL's Chevy Chase made Ford the object of his own imitations. Bush cited this as a valuable lesson in learning to laugh at one's self as a part of public life. "I'd tell you more about that," Bush continued, "but as Dana Carvey would say, [imitating Carvey imitating him] 'Not gonna do it! Wouldn't be prudent!'"."

name: snachicat
text: SPLUT

name: cpnglxynchos
text: i love that line...so classic.

name: davidbowie
text: YES! My vote finally means something. If only I could cast it for smuckles/hawk 08

text: I personally wonder if this is what REALLY happens when someone has to drop out of the running for president.

name: usversusthem

text:
The voodoo enchantment that animates her corpse prevents
her from rotting, actually.

name: mysterymeat1001
text: Great. Now I'm picturing Weekend At Bernie's II with John McCain's mother.

name: drskradley
text:
When the Pirates of the Caribbean sequels were still a mere fancy in our minds, and the Curse of the Black Pearl was the movie to watch over and over again, some friends and I discussed what the sequels would or could or should be. The only solution, in my mind, was the obvious one:

Jack and Will find out about Barbossa's vast buried treasure, but they have to find out more from contacts in Tortuga or there's a voodoo curse that stops them from getting the gold themselves or something, so they have to dig up the Captain's rotting corpse and pretend like he's still alive. Is obvious choice.

Thus:

Pirates of the Caribbean: Weekend at Barbossa's

name: drskradley
text:
We then threw around ideas of Debbie Does Barbossa and/or Barbossa Does Barbados , etc etc.

Then we had microwave supermarket pizza with Old El Paso bacon salsa and a full bag of mozzarella added and had trouble shitting the next day.

Fin

name: bjorntd
text: I CAN'T STOP GIGGLING . Why Can I Not Chubby This More?

name: mysterymeat1001
text:
Beautiful! I think I would have preferred your sequels to the ones they did make.

And I've had similar experiences with Totino's Pizza Rolls. When you're hungry for them it seems like you can sit down and eat a whole 80-count bag, but around 20-25 the world starts sloshing and gurgling around you, and somewhere in the 30s you sink into a kind of green hell-trance.

Anyway. I leave you with this thought: Gentlemen Prefer Barbossa .

name: kamet
text: Aaaah.. I see.. you were HIGH, weren't you.  Chubbaroo!

name: skrizach
text: John McCain's mother looks like a TV sitcom twentysomething in old person makeup.

name: spectre
text: I, alas, cannot stop imagining Ma Smuckles pulling down Ray's thong to get at his "little pink tush." I will drink. That may help.

name: greatwhite
text: Ray's mom is smokin'. And a take charge kinda lady. I'm into that.

name: lateadopter
text: Ramses would only be with a woman who could kick his ass.

name: spinynorman
text: Yet he would never kick ass in front of her. That would be a Rude Thing.

name: loneal
text: Whereas taking a woman to Bakersfield and winning the Great Outdoor Fight is a Ruuuuude Thing.

name: bjorntd
text: Ramses Smuckles would never run for president. He does, however, kick men's asses and vote.

name: shenred
text:
Hmm, that could explain Ray's motives for running. He knows that his dad votes, maybe he's seeking the attention and support that he lacked as a child...

Of course, Ramses is too hard for nepotism. He'd probably vote for Ray's opponent to instill some character from afar.

name: whoisspain
text:
Ach, Ramses doesn't seem to me to be a tactical voter, even if it is for reasons of Moral Learning.

As a true badass, he weighs up the candidates and makes a reasoned decision based on the issues at hand. He might vote for Ray. He might not. But the fact that Ray is his son will not sway him one bit. To take that into account would be silly . It would be a silly vote.

name: lawbot
text:
Unless you are an older cartoon cat, I think you have a problem.

Are you ever honest with yourself, greatwhite, about everything?

name: flandango
text: Ray cannot swear about his mother or her actions.  No man swears about Ray's mother.

name: mrclarinet
text: Would you be even more into it if she sat on your birthday cake?

name: lost_buoy
text: Thwarted by a spanking, but indifferent to shooting. Ray is a Dude of Complexity.

name: usversusthem
text: No way, man. This is just like that scene in Apocalypse Now where the soldiers put their helmets underneath their balls for protection. Dudes hate being fucked with in their private places.

text:
at the heart of it, the fact of the matter is Ray is still a Mama's Boy.

i mean, come on. remember that time he bought his mom's cheese on eBay?

name: usversusthem
text: I was trying not to, actually.

name: cpnglxynchos

text: You fucking bastard. I was in mid-chew.

name: robobogle
text:
It's hard to back down. Even when everyone else can see that you've gone too far. Ray has played this perfectly, nobody will ever be able to say that he didn't have a chance.

This is what moms are for, guys.

name: cousinted
text:
Mother do you think
they'll try and break
My balls?

name: gormster
text:
Oooh ahh
Mother should I build a wall?

name: the_stoned_one
text:
mother should i run for president
mother should i trust the government

I guess after you spend so much time cleaning up after your small children and watching them do stupid things you think a bit less of their ideas of grandeur.
i mean Ray might have a bit of fun being president but he could get shot!
theres not much chance of that just chilling in the hot tub, burning one and listening to The Police

name: morelaak
text:
...

sir, you have said something true today. nothing bad has ever come from sitting in a hot tub, blazing up and hittin the play button on the Bose. EVER.

name: lateadopter
text: You never saw Eating Raoul, I guess.

name: morelaak
text:
is this a specific "hot tub, lit up, listening to music" bad thing?

if not, then the ideal still stands.

name: lateadopter
text:
It is specific, as is vreeeee's example. From these two fictional cinematic data points, we can safely generalize to real life and conclude that nihilists or cannibalistic suburban restaurateurs are highly likely to appear as a direct consequence of lighting up in any tub while music is playing.

I will send flowers, and remember you more or less fondly.

name: bixschmix
text: I have, in the recent past, burned one while in a bubble bath with some mad tunes playing. I am happy to report that no nihilists or cannibalistic restaurateurs appeared. I will repeat this experiment with the Police and report back to the class at a later date.

name: anitrophaeron
text: If you fail to report back we will assume the worst.

name: professorhazard
text: Nice marmot.

name: catgrl131
text: Forgive me, but- What's a marmot?

name: baryonyx
text:
The following is a marmot.
[IMGS OFF]

name: rowboat
text: Wow. I always thought he said "nice varmint." I believe that I may be wrong, but I can say with a fair amount of certainty that what they dropped into his tub was not a marmot. I don't know where that leaves us on this...

name: oingoboingirl
text: yeah, The Dude calling the animal the wrong name was sort of the funny part

name: rowboat
text: Obviously, I'm not a golfer.

name: eatmorekix
text: i haven't seen that movie in a long time, but i'm pretty sure it's a ferret that they drop into the bathtub. just for your edification.

name: l_u_l_z
text: That is adorable and creepy at the same time.

name: vreeeee
text: Nice marmot.

name: zeal
text: Well played, vreeeee.  Well played.

name: madnes
text: Seconded. The motion passes, Lebowski references are still awesome.

name: professorhazard
text: And once again I am afflicted with a case of the Shoulda Scrolled Downs Syndrome.

name: spinynorman
text:
I still am having difficulty seeing anyone respectable standing in front of the nation and saying the equivalent of, "Sorry guys, I can't come out and play. My mom says no. See you later, I guess..."

I don't care how they're dressed when they say that, you hear those words and you immediately start imagining them in red Oshbegosh overalls. With big yellow buttons.

name: missbee
text: Oshkoshbegosh?

name: spinynorman
text:
There we go, I knew it was something like that.

I suppose I can't be blamed for not having an encyclopedic knowledge of... ugh... children's clothes.

name: streever
text: You don't get to make babies, if that is the attitude you have, sir.

name: spinynorman
text: From what I've seen, people tend to make babies whether they know about kids' clothes, tuition costs, or babies at all.

name: blindspot
text: Britney, Q.E.D.

name: streever
text: You are both wrong. Maybe I live in a happy fantasy land, but that simply doesn't happen, in my experience. People who make babies know what they are doing. Also, they make babies by eating three candy canes on christmas day.

name: i_love_kate
text: Oh, fuck. Not now! I'm too young for this!

name: norrin
text: I fear my mother more than any other being on earth. If a man with a gun told me to run for president and my mom said not to, I would be shot.

name: semiquaver
text: In America, any man who tells you to run for president has a gun. It sort of comes with being assertive over here.

name: semiquaver
text: Why lame me?  I mean it's not like I think that's a good thing.

name: iidebaser
text: don't fuck with a lady wearing a goddamn magic shirt.

name: straw
text: Is it magic because the button side switches mid-conversation?

name: nutmeg
text: try to explain that with science straw just try to rationalize. you can't.

name: lateadopter
text:
Panels 4 and 5 have both her buttons and her hair reversed from panel 1.

Explanation:

In panel 1, she was checking her look in the hallway mirror, with the handset in her left hand. One must always be at one's best while dressing down a wayward son. We see her view in the mirror.

In panels 4 and 5, we no longer see the mirror view, but are looking directly at her. She has switched the handset to her right hand, as well.

name: lateadopter
text: Sorry, that's not right.  Panels 4 and 5 are the mirror view.  Women's jackets have the buttons on the left.

name: fuckyoufriday
text: Yeah, what's the deal with that, anyway? Gender is weird.

name: nokococo
text: Because, back in days of old, men dressed themselves, while women were dressed by servants, and the servants were mostly right-handed, so they flipped them.  The buttons, not the servants.  HISTORY'D.

name: lateadopter
text:
Men's buttons are on the right because knights held the lance in their right hands while jousting. The left side of their armor had to overlap the right side, or else it would catch the tip of a lance and direct it into the chest, killing the knight. Women's buttons are on the left because that's the opposite of the fashion for men (read: knights who about doing violent things).

That's what I heard, anyway.

name: lost_buoy
text:
"You joust well, sir! I offer you another lance."

"Yes! Another lance!"

name: foetus_punch
text: Yeah, pretty much correct, except men didn't dress themselves. Nope, those austere gentlemen had pages to do it for them. The reason the buttons were on the right side is because men drew their swords on the right, and they didn't want it catching. And fuck the page. (On that note, does anyone get a severe feeling that being sent off to be a page is a condemnation to years of being terror-laid? Maybe it's just me, but I am certain that those boisterous old lords saw any creature with a high enough voice as raping material after a few drinks.) So...yeah, it's a combo.

name: lastlarf
text: Yeah that's basically how I have heard it came about. The thing about pages though, no, I'm not so sure about that, Mr. Punch.

name: nokococo
text: My history has been updated.  Much appreciated, all.

name: clever-nickname
text:
You're all wrong.

Women have their buttons on the left because they don't have rights.

name: professorhazard
text: NICE.

name: iidebaser
text:
I'm actually picturing something more like an alien symbiote here, periodically rearranging itself, gelatinous tendrils unwrapping, shifting, resolidifying. very unnerving to those who witness it.

this also explains why ray seems to be ready to quit the race, when her warning about the G.O.F. went unheeded: men have died from her spankings.

text:
straw i guess i'm not very good at it but i was trying to use a type of humor as well. i do not in fact believe in magic nor do i believe that onstad intentionally endowed mrs. smuckles' blouse with magical inverting abilities.
just to clear things up, i also have a pair of eyes, and i'm pretty proud of them. they may not be the most perfect eyes but they are the only ones attached to my particular brain and they show my brain some pretty ok things sometimes.

name: flash1087
text:
I had an elementary teacher named Sondra, I believe in third grade. Real nice lady, the daughter of German immigrants. Similar hairstyle and glasses, though, and were she to call me now and tell me I can't be President I'd probably abide by her.

Fun fact: I once unintentionally stole a Transformers 'Choose-Your-Own-Adventure' novel from her class. To this day I feel terrible about it.

name: comrade_tom
text:
regret is the first step to rehabilitation, but you sir (or indeed mandam, either way it doesnt matter to me or the good people of this message board) have commited a crime that is beyond pardon. the theft of literature is oen thing, but to steal an interactive cartoon series cash in form a hallowed educational establishement is to rob the education of thousands and in the words of John Stewart Mill "That is robbing the Human race, posterity as well as the present generation" and that sir (or madam) is despicable.
DE-spicable.
for shame

name: flash1087
text: WHAT CAN I DO TO REDEEM MY TORTURED AND WANDERING SOUL?!

name: comrade_tom
text:
Noting else for it, I recommend you join a monsatic order as soon as possible (preferably coptic, speaking of which did you hear about George Clooney? anyway...)
Either that or fix up an old studebaker and drive it to the edge of town with some springsteen playing while cursing the day your life fell apart.
either will surfice.

text: I was going to say self-flagellation but that works fine too I guess.

name: flash1087

name: falseprophet
text:
There came a time in her life when she could hear all of the accumulated lies in another man's voice.

It comes faster when that other man is your son.

Ray's had this coming for a while. Oh how I wish the mother of everyone currently campaigning would call their offspring and threaten them like this. Even the dead ones.

ESPECIALLY THE DEAD ONES.

What if he wins purely on write-in votes?

The chicken vote is not one to let a little thing like someone's mother stop them from getting their platform some time on the damn spotlight.

name: peterjoel
text: Sondra's jacket buttons up in the opposite direction in panels 4 and 5, compared with panel 1. Unless we are seeing her in a mirror...

name: biff
text:
Women's clothing buttons right side over left, while men's clothing buttons left side over right.

Therefore, panel one is a straight-on view, and panels four and five are reflections.

name: cpnglxynchos
text:
or that O just 'flipped' her in Photoshop...

"po-tay-to", "po-tah-to".

name: flash1087
text: Apparantly Ray's speech patterns are genetic. "...a tragic woman with all her babies dead" is pure Smuckles talk.

name: lucidz
text:
Of course... You realize, she forbid him once before for pursuing what he must do....

[IMGS OFF]

Perhaps she's just telling him what he needs to hear...

name: cpnglxynchos
text: basically, yes.

name: baryonyx
text: Oh wow. That was dedicated .

name: kenyot
text: Chubby! Chubby! One thousand times Chubby!!

name: jordstar
text: There was never graphic threat of spanking to dissuade So-Rod from the Fight.

name: spinynorman
text:
His reaction to being forbidden to run for President was way more solid than the GoF, though. Notice the arm positions. When she says he can't be in the GoF, he holds his hands up in the air and yells jubilantly about three days, three acres, three THOUSAND men. With the presidency, he crosses his arms and says, "CRAP!"

In these two situations one man has paid attention to his mother. Which one was it.

name: flazisismuss
text:
A more cogent reason to forbid Ray from becoming Prez is that nobody whose entire wardrobe is a thong and medallion ever has won an American presidential election.

Well, at least not since John Quincy Adams.

name: varnish
text: I think I prefer this one. The expression matches the pose. He's an elegant cat of the old school.

name: lucidz
text:
Crap, I'm too late....

[IMGS OFF]

name: lost_buoy
text: Expression and text = win.

name: lost_buoy
text: By the way, anyone notice how angry President Adams has been lately?

name: spinynorman
text:
John Quincy Adams was something of an asshole, for real, and he straight up had no problem with telling you that. I believe I read a quote from him that said, "I am not one who is ready to show compassion to strangers. I am not sociable. I have little need for good graces or for shallow shows of affection, all of which have overtaken the minutes of the day until most of one's time is spent reassuring someone they have never met before that they are well-liked, and consequently very little is accomplished at all."

That's from memory, so it may be off a little, but he was a real bad-ass.

name: rowboat
text: That quote doesn't make him sound like an asshole. It makes him sound like a reasonable man.

name: rajib
text: It's amazing how John Quincy Adams managed to summarize MySpace, some 200 years before its creation.

name: lucidz
text:
fucking.
awesome.

chubbied for truth

text: Not just MySpace, but internet etiquette in general, really. Megachubbies for your excellent statement.

text: Phantom chubbies from the over-friendly

Well. You get the idea.

name: hbaranov
text: He who dares, wins?

name: pyromancer
text: I love how Ray reacts to his mom as though he's been caught having a wank or something.

name: mattfish
text: I think I might buy the CRAP. panel on a shirt.

name: powderfinger
text: so this one kinda clears up why Little Nephew lives with Ray. Uncle Ray being the last living babie of Momma Smuckes and all.

name: opalleye
text: A great non-sequitur ending to a huge build-up of a story arc.

name: bluejay
text: On the real.

name: songbirdspectre
text: What is Ray doing with his hands when he says God Dammit?

name: singtralala
text: uhm, looks like he's about to cross his arms

name: foea
text: He's throwing them up in resignation, because he knows he's never going to win without his own mother's endorsement.

name: lucidz
text: I believe its fist pumping.... Not to be confused with pumping... Or fisting...

name: lost_buoy
text: Or pimping.

name: catgrl131
text: Or fusting

name: phy
text: Go watch the Bakshi Lord of the Rings some time.  Gandalf does this a lot. It's like he's milking the Giant Cow.

name: clever-nickname
text: The Bakshi Lord of the Rings is probably the most ridiculous movie i've ever seen, animation-wise. Some of their gesticulations and facial expressions are beyond ridiculous.

name: carten
text:
All of Bakhi's work is like that.

Wizards had a great ending, though.

name: clever-nickname
text:
Honestly, my friend and I spent all of Wizards joking about their faces and voices.

But I agree, the final duel between the two Wizards was the best.

name: pyro_ike
text: Thank you, Mrs. Smuckles, for wrenching Ray's eyebrows out of the grumpy position.  I hope church has been nice lately.

name: shineboxx
text: My second favorite alt text.

name: gbeaton
text: I really didn't like this arc until this strip. Hooray for Ray's Mom.

name: miku224
text: The smuckles eyebrows are definitely hereditary.

name: cpnglxynchos
text: your avi frightens me.

name: loneal
text: It's blowing my mind. The rest of my night is shot. I'm looking at that thing till the sun comes up.

name: lateadopter
text: Just avoid the hot tub, and keep the music to a minimum.

name: loneal
text: Oh my God hover your mouse over that avatar HOVER YOUR MOUSE OVER THAT AVATAR

name: lateadopter
text: What, do you want brain damage?!

name: foetus_punch
text: Alright, my plan: step 1) take shrooms step 2) find avi step 3) roll over avi step 4) play some techno/psychedelic double music, a la Todd. step 5) awesome/death

name: cpnglxynchos
text: both tracks: The Golden Path by The Chemical Brothers, exactly fourteen seconds offset from each other.

name: bjorntd
text:
IT'S SO...
IT'S SO FRIKKIN' SWEET

IT'S SO ... IMPORTANT
[IMGS OFF]

name: lost_buoy
text:
bjorntd? Dude? Oh crap....

CLEAR! *fzzzssshhhzzap!*

name: foetus_punch
text: Today, my ideas, and the ideas of another man, have killed two men.

name: padraig
text: It's obvious momma Smuckles taught Ray everything he knows about getting things done.

name: cpnglxynchos
text: this one, however, is rad.

name: shades
text: if Onstad is really axing this arc already...

name: bourbonsamurai
text: It does seem like the arcs have been somewhat...truncated recently. Wasn't the longest one recently about Todd and cocaine?

name: baryonyx
text: You'll have to be more specific. There are several long arcs about Todd and cocaine.

name: lost_buoy
text: It seems shorter when you're whacked on cocaine, though.

name: foetus_punch
text: Yeah, I have noticed that. It's been bugging me. He (Onstad) just gets us all riled up, and he repeatedly just cuts them off with deus ex machina style endings. I've also noticed the cocaine thing.

name: rowboat
text: I'm ready for a more random one-offs, myself.

name: bourbonsamurai
text: agreed.

name: serf
text: Great way to end it. Ray was starting to be a little too much of a headstrong jackass, it was awesome to see his mom put him in his place.

name: flash1087
text: OH GOD, HAVE I STOLEN YOUR AVATAR?

name: serf
text: aint no big thing the more boognish the merrier.

name: sharkofsomerton
text:
Is Mrs. Smuckles Implying that L.N.'s parents are in a better place?

A future story arc in unfurled before our humble eyes

name: blarghamagarky
text: Maybe he is telling us this story so he can tell us that one

name: kelissamunz
text: I love Ray's mom, if only because of crap like this. The wine has not so far impaired her Mom abilities that she does not recognize when there are Shenanigans afoot.

name: hardcorebrat
text: The pink part of a cats tush.....um... eeeewwww. I like her cuz she is a hard-core lady ;)

name: theargentinian
text: A comment left by theargentinian was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by missbee, snowman, Thorfinn, kylank, wargasmic, snoozebar, Comrade_Tom)

name: d-pad
text:
{insert chubby and praise of comment}

On second thought, "insert chubby" just sounds way too dirty.

name: bjorntd
text: [insert facsimile of a chuckle and make exclamations regarding the relative "meta-ness" of assetbar]

name: baryonyx
text: [insert tangentially-related pun or wordplay principally featuring dialogue from a renowned Achewood strip]

name: elzilcho
text: [insert "insert joke here" joke here]

name: myrrdisparo
text: {insert snide comment doubting the sexual inclinations of every single person involved in the thread as a closing statement, preferably voiced in words most fifteen-year-olds could relate to}

name: foetus_punch
text: Dude, I'm fifteen. Cool it.

name: loneal
text: Are you implying that everyone should only write things that are totally devoid of content? Or are you implying that you are too cool for the concept of a message board?

name: theargentinian
text: i think i was implying that all the comments i read seem to fall under one of the aforementioned categories. On the other hand, i think i was also implying that i was a douchebag. Now I can't make up my mind as to the implications.

name: lost_buoy
text:
theargentinian wishes to take that one back, it seems.

[IMGS OFF]

name: cpnglxynchos
text:
crap. i am out of chubbies. i would so give this one.

...i may even make this my desktop background..

name: lost_buoy
text: Thanks, man. You are a true patron.

name: cpnglxynchos
text: i done did it .

name: lost_buoy
text: Now I'm out of chubbies. Nice follow-through.

name: tekende
text: Also out of chubbies, but that is fantastic.

name: snowman
text: I'm not even going to lame this.  I wanted to tell you in a comment:  this is lame.

name: ubermensch
text:
Huh.

Well I guess it was a good arc while it lasted.

name: wittyname
text: Well at least now we know where Ray got his furrowed eyebrows from.

name: vermy
text: Ray's grumpiness has NOTHING on Mrs. Smuckles'

name: comrade_tom
text: Kind of nice not to see Onstad (or "The O man" as i'm sure he is affectionately known by his household staff and clients) Isnt going to be tied down by the X runs for president arc every four years, dont get me wrong this was a good arc, but i'm worried about the "Teodor runs for california state congress for the progressives in the the 2010 mid-terms" arc this pattern could inevitably lead to.

name: jawsh
text: exactly why i haven't run

name: optimistprime
text:
Guess we know where Little Nephew comes from then.

I wonder if Ray has a dead brother or a dead sister.

name: ubermensch
text: That's sort of implied with the "all her babies dead" remark thrown out by Mrs. Smuckles up in the fourth panel.

name: flash1087
text: I didn't even think about that. Between this and Dornheim, how many Smuckles don't we know about?

name: atrusrand
text: Ray's mom's name is Sondra Smuckles. Huh.

name: ghostd
text: AWW, MOM!

name: mikeleffel2
text: This is why Achewood SPANKS MY LITTLE PINK TUSH.

name: mikeleffel2
text: ...of course it is nowhere near little. :/

name: cpnglxynchos
text: and all of the fellas say "TMI".

name: zem
text: NEI IMO

name: miseryandthesun
text: I fucking love achewood.

name: ninjaein
text:
This proves that, even though Ray is full of unbridled badassness, his momma will be there to give him the solid whoopin' that he deserves from time to time.

As odd as it is to say, I never thought I'd see the day that Ray truly was whipped.

name: strix22
text: People shoot Presidents.

name: bjorntd
text: I was listening to NPR this morning. Apparently some people don't want to vote for Obama because they are afraid he'd get assassinated. This was sort of a preoccupation for me as well. But I figure another high-profile racially motivated political assassination is exactly what this country needs to tip us into the brink of anarchy and revolution.

name: falseprophet
text: If you ask me, that is terrorism. Yeah, thousands of human beings died because of the attacks on the Pentagon and the World Trade Center, but the legacy of racism is so long and storied in this country that this fear will come up whenever a candidate like Obama steps up for centuries to come.

name: chuvak
text: I think the racist organizations that WOULD assassinate a black president are too underfunded, undermanned, and disorganized any more to pull that off.

name: chuvak
text: On the other hand, maybe Vonnegut had a point when he indicated that this may be exactly what they want us to think...

name: comrade_tom
text:
"GAD DANGIT Jethro! Where the hell did you put the GAD DANG Semtex?"

"Ah Put it by the confederate flag ya fuckin' yeller bellied sonofabitch"

"GAD DANGIT! It AINT there asshole. Jesus, we aint never gonna kill that sonofabitch at this rate!"

name: laserblade
text: DENISE!  Are you crappin'?!

name: powderfinger
text: how well funded/manned/organized do you need to be to shoot a fella. Cold Charles Guiteau style.

name: comrade_tom
text: Youre talking about guys who still believe God was born in a missisipi log cabin and hates black folks. These guys have to take courses in high school just to figure out how to un-do their flies, shooting a president is a huge undertaking compared to that.

name: chuvak
text: the best-protected fella in the world. of course - that crazy guy shot reagan, and he didn't even do any sort of real planning.

name: swatson
text: But Overcompensating thinks Ray has a chance!

name: ajg
text: Excellent avatar.  The b*****es, they do indeed love you.

name: solobuttons
text: Parents, huh!

name: vorrishnikov
text: This beats holding Mickey Mouse at gunpoint. Mick, he's a great guy.

name: sevendaughters
text:
Does Mrs. Smuckles know how much volume he does? DOES SHE KNOW HOW MUCH VOLUME HE DOES?

Ray looked set to go the way of Fontanelle until this timely intervention.

name: tbtabby
text: "ALL her babies?" What happened to Ray's other siblings?

name: shades
text: you guys are reading into that way too much

name: shades
text: should have elaborated even more: a BUNCH of kennedy children died young. it's almost hard to keep track, but at least 3 other kennedy children besides JFK died early. which is why ray's mom refers to babies, plural.

name: lost_buoy
text: And Ted's been drinking embalming fluid for years now, it seems.

name: cpnglxynchos
text: ahh, Diet anything.

name: steerpike66
text: Silence. What he did to the Clintons was pretty badass. Even if he looks like the liberal Newt Gingrich and left that woman blah blah blub blub.

name: eatmorekix
text: and even if he ogled my mom

name: comrade_tom
text: Wait a minute phillipes mom never did this did she? Man thats cold of phillipe's mom, all the walking butts in the world can't cover up the fact she was fine with her son running for president and almost certainly getting shot!

name: snowman
text: why would he almost certainly be shot?

name: featurelessvoid
text: Didn't your Mom ever sit you down and have that talk with you?  Look what happened to that lovely Kennedy family.

name: blarghamagarky
text: Policies like puppies named Mr. Poopytime are a controversial policy, not everyone wants our country to be brought together.

name: baryonyx
text: Philippe's platform was highly controversial. For example, his stance on Homosexuals.

name: myrrdisparo
text: Although Homosexuals was a pretty cool mascot. I'm sure most gay dudes and lesbian dames would have loved it. They have a fantastic sense of humor.

name: bjorntd
text: No one would ever shoot Phillipe. He is a very special boy.

name: trubbles
text: This is a LAME WAY OUT for onstad. I thought this thread had a lot of potential. I hope onstad has something good planned.

name: streever
text: I thought this arc had 0 potential, and this was an AWESOME way out. Honestly!

name: streever
text:
Sorry, I kinda wanna explain what I am thinking? Is that OK? Do you mind?

In my mind, the best arcs (all of them) dealt with some pretty surreal subject matter--your subaru brat in hell, for instance--and adding a normal human element to it.

This is more of a satire or a commentary, I think, then a truly original surreal & bizarre concept, so for me, it falls a little flat. I am really looking forward to more bizarre story arcs.... fake manes, wearing cups full of water around the waist, etc.

name: brynito
text:
222 comments is just too dang many! I declare the comment section officially beyond useless.
Also, Ms Smuckles looks very much like Ms Reagan here, mixed with a little Jackie O. Is that Chanel? Daaaang.

name: banjobird
text:
All of the comments on this page in size twelve font add up to less than ten pages.

Are you telling me that you'd be put off by reading the equivolent of "The Little Train That Could"?

name: loneal
text: Keep in mind, the longer it gets the more useless it gets. In comparison to the usefulness of, say, The Brothers Karamazov , or The Sound and the Fury , "The Little Engine That Could" is a goddamn perpetual motion machine.

name: juanclaudius
text: Dude. NOT COOL. Keep Faulkner out of this. KEEP FAULKNER OUT OF THIS.

name: andrew_
text:
I just got an e-mail from Mr. Onstad. I'll paraphrase:

Dear avid reader,
I've been keeping an eye on your comments in this assetbar of ours. They're wonderful. Everyone must really like you. Keep up the good work.
Sincerely, Chris Onstad.

p.s. I will be sending out emails to most other people who read my comic, but those emails will just be newsletters, yours was the only one I put love and care into.

name: foetus_punch
text: Yaaay! Good for you! (There is no sarcasm intended, please do not take it that way). (Or meta-sarcasm). (Look, to prevent an infinite regress you're just going to have to take my word on it. It's hard to prove on the internet!)

name: bjorntd
text:
:-(

I... I thought Onstad's love was a forbidden mount to such as us. It is wrong to be jealous. So I stand here being wrong.

name: eatmorekix
text: dude he didn't actually receive such an email are you crazy

name: foetus_punch
text: Of course he didn't. But a man can dream can't he? A man can dream.

name: streever
text:
A man can dream, yes, unless another man ties him up & uses toothpicks to keep his eyelids open.

Don't be alone tonight, Mr Punch, don't be alone.

name: foetus_punch
text:
I am going to take you and strip your clothes and clean off all the dirt and germs from your body with the hot, hot water until you are all clean and then I'm going to open your eyes with little hook and clean them off too and then I'm going to let my dog pull all of the slippery blue snakes out of your belly, so he won't be hungry, and I'll let you lie in a basement until you're finally quiet again and your skin goes all crusty and you smell.

I'm sorry. I instinctively respond to threats in kind. It's embarrassing, really.

name: bjorntd
text: Thankfully, I can't chubby either of you, saving us from a very awkward conversation about the true spirit of a chubby. I think this is something we can all be grateful for.

name: streever
text: I'm grateful.

name: streever
text: Oh, but I wasn't threatening you, Mr Punch. I was promising you.

name: foetus_punch
text: Oh, alright then. Considering you made no actual direct statements, and therefore you aren't promising anything, we cool. Props?

name: sharkofsomerton
text: On a unrelated note. I just took a few blasts from a homemade bong and have Tom Waits playing. Its a good night

name: rainbowbrite
text: I am also floating in a happy stoned way, listening to Bowie, and reading comics.  Life is awesome.

name: applebed
text: This message is the little chocolate reward at the end of my Cornetto <3

name: comrade_tom
text: out of chubbies but you deserve one nonetheless, Bowie and the awesomeness of life tend to go hand in hand.

name: eatmorekix
text: also, your avatar is what Bowie would look like if he was a magical pony.

name: rainbowbrite
text: *Smiles and goes into an infinitely better fantasy world where David Bowie stars in a live action film version of 'Rainbow Brite'* :-).

name: zem
text: i thought that was 'labyrinth'

name: rainbowbrite
text: In 'Labyrinth' he was Jareth the Goblin King, not Starlight "the most magnificent horse in the universe"!  It's difficult to see how you would mix the two up...

name: foetus_punch
text: Labyrinth was a major influence on my childhood development, and when I first saw a David Bowie album cover I said "Hey, it's Jareth!" I did not understand the lack of goblins or mane.

name: rainbowbrite
text: Watching Labyrinth whilst high can be a scary experience.

name: straw
text: If by scary you mean awesome.

name: zem
text: whatev

name: carten
text: The Spaghetti Incident!

name: wittyname
text: With nearly 300 comments it's hard to tell if this hasn't been said yet, but: Anyone else notice that Sondra says she won't "be a tragic woman with all her children dead"? Could this be the relation to Little Nephew and why he lives with Ray?

name: fineoakstructure
text: Oops, I chubbied accidentally, but just take it as consolation in case I sound like a dick (I'm not trying to):  Yes, this possibility has been said several times above.

name: lawbot
text: First time I read it.

name: fineoakstructure
text: There are at least three comments from 2 days ago above that echo similar sentiments, as far as I can tell.  Just do a "Find" search in your browser for "nephew" and/or "l.n." and you'll see.

name: lawbot
text: I have better things to do with my time. That includes posting this.

name: wittyname
text: No, you didn't sound like a dick.

name: streever
text: In a universe where no means yes, I'd say, no, not at all.

name: fineoakstructure
text: Yes.

name: streever
text:
Honestly this was my favorite of the arc so far.

This one and the first one...

I like pretty much EVERY arc, but I think maybe, for me, the idea of ray becoming president is just too real & not at all the bizarre surreal adventure that achewood usually provides... a 5 year old otter going to the super secret ice cream shop, or to the trash dump to rescue the couch? Buying AirWolf? Cartilage Head, Stoned Lightning, I mean, heck, I could write these out all day, and you don't care. None of you care at all. Forget you guys.

name: tagrineth
text: I still find it amusing that the cats hold the earpiece of their phones somewhere arbitrarily against the side of their head, rather than actually at their ear .

name: baryonyx
text: Ray has also been known to hold his phone out in front of him, looking at it as he speaks.

name: ubermensch
text: What's holding Ray's glasses up?

name: samcc
text: Gumption.

name: ubermensch
text: [IMGS OFF]

name: deusoma
text: I'm not sure exactly how Ray pronounced the word "Mommmm". Surely if you were going to extend 'Mom', you'd go for the Os?

name: tragicone
text:
Ray is a straight up bitch for this.

Presidency is more important than your mother.

name: genequagmire
text: Spanking the asshole is harsh.
